Authors:
Alcindo da Silva Martins Jr, Cassia Monica Sakuragui, Joe
Fletwood Hennen, Anibal Alves Carvalho Jr
Title:
Neopuccinia (Pucciniales): a new Puccinia-like genus from the
Brazilian Cerrado
Abstract:
Neopuccinia, a new Pucciniales genus, based on N. bursa
found on Protium heptaphyllum (Burseraceae) in the Brazilian Cerrado, is
described and illustrated. The combined phylogenetic analyses of
molecular data from nuc rDNA 18S and 28S markers demonstrate that the
new taxon is an independent lineage and thus a taxonomically distinct
unit. It is morphologically characterized by bag-like projections
arising from the bicellular teliospore wall, like those found in
Puccinia.
